DataElement.preferredName: Bone Sarcoma Or Soft Tissue Sarcoma Primary Primary Anatomic Site
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Name of the anatomic site in which a primary sarcoma originated.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Bone Sarcoma Or Soft Tissue Sarcoma Disease or Disorder Primary Occurrence
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A malignant mesenchymal tumor arising from the bone._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._A malignant mesenchymal neoplasm arising from muscle tissue, adipose tissue, blood vessels, fibrous tissue, or other supportive tissues excluding the bones._Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value._An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Bone Sarcoma Or Soft Tissue Sarcoma Disease or Disorder
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A malignant mesenchymal tumor of the bone.  Bone sarcomas can either arise from the bones (primary bone sarcomas) or spread to the bones from other anatomic sites. --2003:Or; used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:A malignant mesenchymal neoplasm arising from muscle tissue, adipose tissue, blood vessels, fibrous tissue, or other supportive tissues excluding the bones.:Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Concepts.definition: A sarcoma that arises from the bone.  Representative examples are osteosarcoma and chondrosarcoma.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
A malignant neoplasm arising from muscle tissue, adipose tissue, blood vessels, fibrous tissue, or other supportive tissues excluding the bones.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: Occurring first in time or sequence; original. (American Heritage Dictionary):Occurrence; an instance of something happening.

Concepts.definition: Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.
An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Sarcoma Primary Malignant Neoplasm Anatomic Site
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A usually aggressive malignant mesenchymal cell tumor most commonly arising from muscle, fat, fibrous tissue, bone, cartilage, and blood vessels.  Sarcomas occur in both children and adults.  The prognosis depends largely on the degree of differentiation (grade) of the tumor.  Representative subtypes are liposarcoma, leiomyosarcoma, osteosarcoma, and chondrosarcoma. -- 2004_A malignant tumor at the original site of growth._Named locations of, or within, the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: For oncology, area of the body generally construed to comprise base of skull and facial bones, sinuses, orbits, salivary glands, oral cavity, oropharynx, larynx, thyroid, facial and neck musculature and lymph nodes draining these areas.

Concepts.definition: For oncology, an area of the body generally construed to comprise the base of skull and facial bones, sinuses, orbits, salivary glands, oral cavity, oropharynx, larynx, thyroid, facial and neck musculature and lymph nodes draining these areas.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The organ of sight or vision.: An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.: The bony cavity of the skull which contains the eye, anterior portion of the optic nerve, ocular muscles and ocular adnexa.  Seven bones contribute to the structure of the orbit: the frontal, maxillary, zygomatic, sphenoid, lacrimal, ethmoid, and palatine bones.: Named locations of, or within, the body.

Concepts.definition: The organ of sight or vision.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.

The bony cavity of the skull which contains the eye, anterior portion of the optic nerve, ocular muscles and ocular adnexa. Seven bones contribute to the structure of the orbit: the frontal, maxillary, zygomatic, sphenoid, lacrimal, ethmoid, and palatine bones.
Named locations of or within the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The skin which covers the top of the head and which is usually covered by hair.

Concepts.definition: The skin which covers the top of the head and which is usually covered by hair.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The anterior portion of the head that includes the skin, muscles, and structures of the forehead, eyes, nose, mouth, cheeks, and jaw. (MeSH)

Concepts.definition: The anterior portion of the head extending from the forehead to the chin and ear to ear. The facial structures contain the eyes, nose and mouth, cheeks and jaws.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Occurring in, or located in the retroperitoneum.

Concepts.definition: Occurring in, or located in the retroperitoneum.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A hollow, thick-walled, muscular organ located within the pelvic cavity of a woman. Within the uterus the fertilized egg implants and the fetus develops during pregnancy.

Concepts.definition: A hollow, thick-walled, muscular organ located within the pelvic cavity of a woman. Within the uterus the fertilized egg implants and the fetus develops during pregnancy.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The region of the body that includes the arm, the forearm, and hand.

Concepts.definition: The region of the body that includes the arm, the forearm, and hand.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: (GAS-tro-in-TES-tih-nul) GI.  Refers to the stomach and intestines.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to the stomach and intestines.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The upper part of the trunk between the neck and the abdomen. It contains the chief organs of the circulatory and respiratory systems. (From Stedman, 25th ed)

Concepts.definition: The division of the body lying between the neck and the abdomen.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The limb that is composed of the hip, thigh, leg and foot.

Concepts.definition: The limb that is composed of the hip, thigh, leg and foot.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The body system that includes all organs involved in reproduction and in the formation and voidance of urine.

Concepts.definition: The body system that includes all organs involved in reproduction and in the formation and voidance of urine.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Connective tissue that forms the skeletal components of the body.

Concepts.definition: The structural organ comprised of specialized connective tissue that forms the skeletal components of the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has but two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border.

Concepts.definition: One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: (PAIR-ih-toe-NEE-um) The tissue that lines the abdominal wall and covers most of the organs in the abdomen.

Concepts.definition: The tissue that lines the wall of the abdominal cavity, intestine, mesentery, and pelvic organs. It consists of the parietal peritoneum and the visceral peritoneum.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A large organ located in the upper abdomen. The liver cleanses the blood and aids in digestion by secreting bile.

Concepts.definition: A triangular-shaped organ located under the diaphragm in the right hypochondrium. It is the largest internal organ of the body, weighting up to 2 kg. Metabolism and bile secretion are its main functions. It is composed of cells which have the ability to regenerate.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2023.3.7 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0002119. ak

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A bean-shaped organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is part of the lymphatic system and is found throughout the body. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and its main function is immune protection.

Concepts.definition: A bean-shaped organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is part of the lymphatic system and is found throughout the body. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and its main function is immune protection.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.

Concepts.definition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The part of the skeleton that includes the skull and spinal column and sternum and ribs.

Concepts.definition: The part of the skeleton that includes the skull and spinal column and sternum and ribs.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A body region referring to an upper or lower extremity.

Concepts.definition: A body region referring to an upper or lower extremity.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated Short Name to be the Public ID per current conventions for VM Short Name. DW 10-03-2022

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The body excluding the head and neck and limbs.

Concepts.definition: The body excluding the head and neck and limbs.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 1/25/23 added alt name for ticket number CADSR0001948 for CCTG cjl.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: locations or structures in the human body.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Sarcoma Primary Malignant Neoplasm Anatomic Site
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A usually aggressive malignant mesenchymal cell tumor most commonly arising from muscle, fat, fibrous tissue, bone, cartilage, and blood vessels.  Sarcomas occur in both children and adults.  The prognosis depends largely on the degree of differentiation (grade) of the tumor.  Representative subtypes are liposarcoma, leiomyosarcoma, osteosarcoma, and chondrosarcoma. -- 2004:A malignant tumor at the original site of growth.:Named locations of, or within, the body.

Concepts.definition: A usually aggressive malignant neoplasm of the soft tissue or bone. It arises from muscle, fat, fibrous tissue, bone, cartilage, and blood vessels. Sarcomas occur in both children and adults. The prognosis depends largely on the degree of differentiation (grade) of the neoplasm. Representative subtypes are liposarcoma, leiomyosarcoma, osteosarcoma, and chondrosarcoma.
A malignant tumor at the original site of growth.
Named locations of or within the body.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 04.10.15 Added Other, Trunk and Extremity for DCI - Sarcoma QoL Project, ghd.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support Duke University clinical trial.
